description: Starts a database activity stream to monitor activity on the database. For more information, see Monitoring Amazon Aurora with Database Activity Streams in the Amazon Aurora User Guide or Monitoring Amazon RDS with Database Activity Streams in the Amazon RDS User Guide.

parameters.name: ResourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DB cluster, for example, arn:aws:rds:us-east-1:12345667890:cluster:das-cluster.

parameters.name: Mode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode of the database activity stream. Database events such as a change or access generate an activity stream event. The database session can handle these events either synchronously or asynchronously.

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for encrypting messages in the database activity stream. The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier is the key ARN, key ID, alias ARN, or alias name for the KMS key.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for encryption of messages in the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: KinesisStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Kinesis data stream to be used for the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The mode of the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: ApplyImmediately
nested_items.description: Indicates whether or not the database activity stream will start as soon as possible, regardless of the maintenance window for the database.

nested_items.name: EngineNativeAuditFieldsIncluded
nested_items.description: Indicates whether engine-native audit fields are included in the database activity stream.
